content.webTitle: Space solves: UPVC paint, stained wood and painting showers revisited

fields.headline: Space solves: UPVC paint, stained wood and painting showers revisited
fields.bodyText: Can you recommend a paint I can use on UPVC windows? If you use a UPVC primer, you can then apply topcoats of traditional paint. DIY expert Julian Cassell recommends International UPVC primer (£11.99 a litre, from focusdiy.co.uk). The windows must be spotlessly clean before the primer is applied, and topcoats (ideally with a gloss finish, for durability) must be applied within a few days because the primer is not weather-resistant. I've inherited some 50s Ercol furniture, but it's stained orange thanks to years of cigarette smoke. Is there a safe way to remove the nicotine without damaging the wood? I'm tempted to try sugar soap. "You are right to be cautious," says our cleaning guru, Stephanie Zia. "Ercol solid wood furniture is made to last and can be restored, but sugar soap is not aggressive enough. Ercol experts Furniture Restoration (01443 231699) point out other considerations: the design, the finish and whether you have coordinating furniture. Your best bet is to get a specialist to strip and repolish the chair using authentic colours and lacquers. Furniture Restoration quotes guide prices of £65-75 for a dining or carver, £125 for a small rocking chair and £180 for an easy chair/armchair." You respond Re Waterproof Paint To Withstand A Shower's Power (12 September), we have a small bathroom that gets steamy very quickly and has water from the shower hitting the walls above the bath. We tried several brands of bathroom paint, but all of them soon peeled and cracked. We then tried white exterior paint and it works brilliantly – the paint is still perfect a year after being applied. Emma Gordon Newmarket, Suffolk • Got a question for our team of experts?
